SEARCH
Package com.hcltech.authservice.controller

Class AuthController

java.lang.Object
com.hcltech.authservice.controller.AuthController
@RestController @RequestMapping("/api/auth") public class AuthController extends Object
REST Controller for handling authentication-related operations. Provides endpoints for user registration, login, logout, and user information retrieval.

All endpoints are prefixed with "/api/auth" and include proper security authorization where required. The controller uses JWT tokens for authentication stored in HttpOnly cookies.

Key features:

  • User registration with role-based access
  • User authentication with JWT token generation
  • Secure logout with cookie clearance
  • User information retrieval for authenticated users
  • Role-based authorization using Spring Security annotations
Since:
2025-11-17
Version:
1.0
Author:
Boobesh Kumar S

  • Method Details

    • authenticateUser

      @PostMapping("/login") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<UserLoginResponseDTO> authenticateUser(@Valid @RequestBody @Valid UserLoginRequestDTO loginRequest)
      Authenticates a user and generates JWT token upon successful login. The token is stored in an HttpOnly cookie for secure client-side handling.

      This endpoint validates the user credentials and returns user information along with authentication token details.

      Parameters:
      loginRequest - the user login credentials containing email and password
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity containing UserLoginResponseDTO with:
      • User details (ID, username, email, roles)
      • JWT token information
      • Token expiration time
      Throws:
      org.springframework.security.authentication.BadCredentialsException - if credentials are invalid
      See Also:
      • UserLoginRequestDTO
      • UserLoginResponseDTO

    • registerUser

      @PostMapping("/register") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<MessageResponseDTO> registerUser(@Valid @RequestBody @Valid UserRegisterRequestDTO registerRequest)
      Registers a new user in the system.

      Validates the registration request and creates a new user account with the provided information. Supports role assignment during registration.

      Parameters:
      registerRequest - the user registration data containing username, email, password, and roles
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity with MessageResponseDTO indicating registration success or failure
      Throws:
      org.springframework.dao.DataIntegrityViolationException - if username or email already exists
      See Also:
      • UserRegisterRequestDTO
      • MessageResponseDTO

    • currentUserName

      @GetMapping("/username") @PreAuthorize("hasAnyRole(\'STUDENT\', \'ADMIN\')") public String currentUserName(org.springframework.security.core.Authentication authentication)
      Retrieves the username of the currently authenticated user.

      This endpoint requires the user to have either 'STUDENT' or 'ADMIN' role. Returns an empty string if no user is authenticated.

      Parameters:
      authentication - the Spring Security authentication object containing user details
      Returns:
      the username of the authenticated user, or empty string if not authenticated
      See Also:
      • Authentication

    • getUserDetails

      @GetMapping("/user") @PreAuthorize("hasAnyRole(\'STUDENT\', \'ADMIN\')") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<UserRegisterResponseDTO> getUserDetails(org.springframework.security.core.Authentication authentication)
      Retrieves detailed information about the currently authenticated user.

      This endpoint requires the user to have either 'STUDENT' or 'ADMIN' role. Returns comprehensive user details including roles, email, and user ID.

      Parameters:
      authentication - the Spring Security authentication object containing user details
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity containing UserRegisterResponseDTO with user details
      See Also:
      • Authentication
      • UserRegisterResponseDTO

    • signoutUser

      @PostMapping("/logout") @PreAuthorize("isAuthenticated()") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<MessageResponseDTO> signoutUser()
      Logs out the currently authenticated user by clearing the JWT cookie.

      This endpoint requires the user to be authenticated and invalidates the session by clearing the authentication cookie.

      Returns:
      ResponseEntity with MessageResponseDTO indicating successful logout and SET-COOKIE header to clear the authentication cookie
      See Also:
      • ResponseCookie
      • MessageResponseDTO
